data.text:
@DrJaimeFriedman So sorry to hear about your fireplace issue! Our FAQ page has a list of potential causes: https://t.co/o0afasXpxk

You can also contact an authorized Heat & Glo dealer for service. Please visit https://t.co/mcNcE14VY4 to find one near you.
@DrJaimeFriedman @Heatilator Have you tried kicking it real hard?  That usually works for me
@DrJaimeFriedman @Heatilator Time to call for a consult 1 (800) 927-6841
@DrJaimeFriedman @gladtobehear @Heatilator Mine died last week. Just remote batteries needed replacement. Sorry your problem is more complicated. Is your pilot on? Wonder if that’s it.
@DrJaimeFriedman @Heatilator Or call someone.  Depends on how bored you are.

@DrJaimeFriedman @Heatilator The remote sends a signal to a receiver which will run a switch.  The remote could be dead, or the receiver could be dead, or the power to the switch could be dead.   With a volt tester you can troubleshoot and figure out which part isn’t working.
@ozziemyers @Heatilator If it needs re-wiring it needs a professional. I’ve already followed the reset instructions multiple times. I think the remote is just dead.
